result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry D. Moore Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry D. Moore in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Larry D. Moore in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-165, 224, 253, 360, 13CM-547 and 14CM-181.

9:56 AM Court calls case and states appearances.

13CM-547 Defendant will plead to
14CF-165 Amend count 1 to MS Battery 940.19(1) Defendant will plead to  Ct 1 and 2 and 3. 
14CF-224, 14CF-253 and 14CF-360 Dismissed and read in
14CM-181 Defendant will plead to

Atty Constable states the plea agreement for the record.
Atty Renc concurs, there is 50 days of jail credit.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.


Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CM-547 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-165 NO CONTEST to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CM-181 NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CM-547 Disorderly Conduct 
14CF-165 Count 1 - amended to Misdemeanor Battery and Count 2 and Count 3
14CM-181 Disorderly Conduct
14CF-224 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-253 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-360 Dismissed and Read In

State has complied with victim notification statutes

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Days credit are addressed.
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:

14CF-165:
Count 1: - amended
150 Days Jail Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 3 Years 
52 Days Credit in event probation is revoked
Huber if approved by jail administration
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations from assessment
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Go to school full time, work full time or combination of both to equal full time
Will allow early dicharge if in full compliance and recommended by the agent.

Count 2:
60 day Jail Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to Count 1
52 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 
Pay costs
Will allow early dicharge if in full compliance and recommended by the agent

Count 3:
90 day Jail Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
52 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2 
Pay costs
Will allow early dicharge if in full compliance and recommended by the agent

13CM-547:
30 day Jail Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to 14CF-165
Probation for a period of 3 Years concurrent to 14CF-165
Only gets 50 days pretrial credit if this is the only case that Defendant is revoked on
Conditions:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CF-165
Pay costs

14CM-181:
30 day Jail, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to any sentence Defendant may be serving
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to 13CM-547 and 14CF-165
Only gets 50 days pretrial credit if this is the only case that Defendant is revoked on
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CM-547 and 14CF-165
Pay costs

Appeal rights are addressed. Any money posted in cases shall be applied to court costs that have been imposed in all cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.

14CF224, 14CF253, 14CF360:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

In 14CF360 - the bond in this file is to be covered under the cash bond in 14CF224.

Defendant Larry D. Moore in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Larry D. Moore in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF224, 14CF253, 14CF360

14CF360 (Initial Appearance Held):
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
